segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, but inside, it’s pure chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is lost in her own world, drying that plate like it’s the only thing that matters.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I almost envy her focus, but it’s also kind of terrifying.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are sneaking cookies, and she has no clue.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is balancing on that stool like a circus act, and the girl is just waiting for her share.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but laugh at how oblivious everyone is to the mess around them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is everywhere, and yet no one seems to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever notice the puddle at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is like a silent comedy, but with real risks.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope they all come out of this unharmed.
segments.speaker: PAR
